title: Self-Directed Social Studies Learning Design Using Anchored-Spin Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education-level social science foundational knowledge and general understanding of instructional design
context.additional_context: Focuses on in-service professionals acquiring instructional design techniques applicable to workplace environments.

learning_goals: Learners can develop one or more social studies learning modules using the Anchored-Scenario Instructional Design Model based on real-world cases.
Learners can improve initial instructional design drafts by 80% or more by incorporating formative assessment feedback.
Learners can share instructional design deliverables on a collaborative platform using personal digital devices (BYOD).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
